paper.title: Reducing Logarithms in Totally Non-maximal Imaginary Quadratic Orders to Logarithms in Finite Fields
paper.abstract: We discuss the discrete logarithm problem over the class group Cl(Δ) of an imaginary quadratic order \({\cal O}_\Delta\), which was proposed as a public-key cryptosystem by Buchmann and Williams [8]. While in the meantime there has been found a subexponential algorithm for the computation of discrete logarithms in Cl(Δ) [16], this algorithm only has running time \(L_{\Delta}[\frac{1}{2},c]\) and is far less efficient than the number field sieve with \(L_p[\frac{1}{3},c]\) to compute logarithms in \(\mathbb{F}_p^*\). Thus one can choose smaller parameters to obtain the same level of security. It is an open question whether there is an \(L_{\Delta}[\frac{1}{3},c]\) algorithm to compute discrete logarithms in arbitrary Cl(Δ).
